artist: Vassily Kandinsky; Introduction by Gérôme Maësse; Published by Editions des Tendances Nouvelles, Paris
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description:
Listed below are the eight parts of this portfolio. Apart from the print on the cover, Roethel called the images heliogravures, but they are here described as photomechanical reproductions since they do not appear to have the etched character of heliogravures. The titles are given in English, German (as Roethel uses for his entry headings), and French (when assigned titles in the Xylographies portfolio). The original blocks were all made in 1907.

2003.180a: grey paper folder cover with Roethel 70.
Layout and text designed by Kandinsky
[possibly a machine printed impression form the original block]
Landscape with Figure and Phoenix
Landschaft mit Figur und Phönix

2003.180b: introductory text

2003.180c: title or index page with photomechanical reproduction of Roethel 66
Flame
Flamme

2003.180d: Photomechanical reproduction of Roethel 59
Clouds / Horsemen
Wolken
Chevaliers

2003.180e: Photomechanical reproduction of Roethel 65
Bird / Birds
Vögel
Les Oiseaux

2003.180f: Photomechanical reproduction of Roethel 55
Church
Kirche
L'Église

2003.180g: Photomechanical reproduction of Roethel 54
Horn / The Birches
Schalmei
Les Bouleaux

2003.180h: Photomechanical reproduction of Roethel 60
Women in the Forest 
Frauen im Wald
Les Femmes au Bois
provenance: Ruth and Bruce Dayton, Wayzata, Minn.; their gift to MIA, 2003.
title: Xylographies
